creditline: Gift of Leo A. and Doris Hodroff
description: five-case inrō; gold fundame with butterflies near bush, clover beside rocky rivulet; cloisonne enamel ojime; ivory manju netsuke painted gold with flowering shrubs in hiramakie; attached with brown braided silk rope through inrō, ties at bottom
medium: Lacquer (takamaki-e); ojime: cloisonné enamel; netsuke: gold lacquer on ivory
signed: on underside of netsuke: 田付隆益作 {Tatsuke Takamasu saku}
title: Five-case inro with decor of bushclover and butterflies; ojime with floral design; netsuke of autumn grasses
